lead_paragraph: Mariusz Kwiecien, cast in the title role of the Metropolitan Opera's highly touted new production of Mozart's "Don Giovanni," injured his back at rehearsal on Monday and was scratched from Thursday's opening night, the Met said. Peter Mattei will take his place. Mr. Kwiecien hurt himself during the opening scene of the dress rehearsal and was taken to the hospital. A Met spokesman said he had no immediate information on the nature of the injury, Mr. Kwiecien's condition or when he might return. Mr. Mattei is appearing at the Met as Figaro in Rossini's "Barbiere di Siviglia."

headline.main: Mariusz Kwiecien Withdraws From Met Performance
